bibl.title: Demarco v. McKay. Petition Attorney Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: writ and the time set of there and then of what the said prosecuting attorny being absent, the hearing was adjourned to a later time on said 8th day for the further hearing upon said return and that thereafter upon said 5th day of March 1887. Affiant appeared before this court, at the time & which the hearing herein was adjourned, with B.W. Coiner the prosecuting attorney for said district and H.F. McKay the respondent herein, and said cause, was by said Court adjourned for further hearing to Mch. 7. 1887 at 6 o'clock P.M. and oral order was than made that the written return in said matter of said respondent should only certain the matters stated by said respondent and the said mother should be tried upon the return as then stated by said respondent, that the return made in writing herein do not show the facts so stated and returned by respondent, but contains entirely new
